paragraphs.body: Courtenay was raised in San Francisco by her English mother and Australian father. She attended college at the University of Redlands and San Francisco State, majoring in Broadcast Communications with a minor in theater. She is married to David Taylor, a former footballer and the current assistant manager of Caersws F.C.
paragraphs.text: Courtenay was raised in San Francisco by her English mother and Australian father. She attended college at the University of Redlands and San Francisco State, majoring in Broadcast Communications with a minor in theater. She is married to David Taylor, a former footballer and the current assistant manager of Caersws F.C.

paragraphs.body: After spending a season in Los Angeles working on HBO's Tales From The Crypt as a production assistant, Courtenay returned to San Francisco to attend the American Conservatory Theater and study voice acting with The Voice Factory's Taylor Korobow. She is a founding instructor at Gorilla Sports, a popular boxing, spinning, and yoga gym that branched out to Manhattan Beach and Chicago.
paragraphs.text: After spending a season in Los Angeles working on HBO's Tales From The Crypt as a production assistant, Courtenay returned to San Francisco to attend the American Conservatory Theater and study voice acting with The Voice Factory's Taylor Korobow. She is a founding instructor at Gorilla Sports, a popular boxing, spinning, and yoga gym that branched out to Manhattan Beach and Chicago.

paragraphs.body: In 1998, Courtenay moved back to Los Angeles and began working steadily in voice-overs, particularly for video games. Recently she has crossed over into on-camera work with roles on prime time TV and in feature films.
paragraphs.text: In 1998, Courtenay moved back to Los Angeles and began working steadily in voice-overs, particularly for video games. Recently she has crossed over into on-camera work with roles on prime time TV and in feature films.
